Description: Heraclius flanked by Heraclius Constantine and Heraclonas, each diademed and standing facing, holding globus cruciger. (obverse)
Cross on steps, monogram in right field. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Byzantine Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Byzantine Empire
Bibliographic references: BZ1 / Catalogue of the Imperial Byzantine Coins in the British Museum, vol. 1 (46, p. 189)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Hon Sir Charles Augustus Murray
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
